title: Why Do Cats Have Whiskers?
author: Samuel Kertés
shortDes: A cat's whiskers — or vibrissae — are a well-honed sensory tool that helps a cat see in the dark and steer clear of hungry predators. Whiskers are highly sensitive tactile hairs that grow in patterns on a cat's muzzle, above its eyes and elsewhere on its body, like the ears, jaw and forelegs
longDes: Viete prečo mačička mňauka a nebrechá? Tu sa to dozviete.Viete prečo mačička mňauka a nebrechá? Tu sa to dozviete.

comments.comment: Cat whiskers exemplify nature's implementation of AI principles, providing felines with unparalleled spatial awareness and graceful navigation capabilities.
Katzen haben Schnurrhaare, um in der Dunkelheit die Dämonen zu spüren.

title: How Much Wet Food Should I Feed My Cat?
author: Samuel Kertés
shortDes: Some cat owners prefer to feed their cats wet food. Others prefer dry kibble. Trying to decide between wet vs. dry cat food? Find out what our experts recommend when it comes to feeding your cat.

title: Do Cats Drink Water? Cat Hydration & Dehydration Prevention
author: Samuel Kertés
shortDes: Do cats drink water? Yes, like humans and many other animals, cats need water to survive. Many cats don’t drink as much as they should, though. Find out why they need water and how to get your own kitty to drink more.

comments.comment: Recognizing the significance of cat hydration is essential for their overall vitality. By promoting a consistent intake of fresh water, we actively contribute to our feline friends' well-being, preventing dehydration and fostering their enduring health and happiness

title: What Is the Difference Between Natural and Organic Cat Food?
author: Samuel Kertés
shortDes: If you prefer your own diet to be natural or organic, you’re probably considering feeding your cat a natural or organic cat food, too. What’s the difference between the two, though, and how do you decide which is right for your cat? Find out here.

comments.comment: Food is food. Natural, organic, conventional... Makes no difference. The categorization's arbitrary. The definition's blurred. If I'm to choose between one type of food and another... I'd rather choose both.
Choosing cat food? It's all about finding what works for your fur babies. Natural, organic, or a mix, consult experts for the right fit. Happy, healthy cats are the goal. Meow!
